channel.title: NPCs hit too high, too fast... Help? ALSO: My servers uptime is at 99%?
channel.description:
Well, my black demons hit about 45's and Jad hits 80's and can hit like 4 times per second...
Question: How do i make a certain NPC hit slower?
[i][s]Question: How do i make a certain NPC hit lower?[/s][/i]
Question: My server uptime is down to 99%?... It has been up 24/7 for about 4 days but it is down to 99%... I haven't even restarted the server for updates...
Thank you. :)

item.source: NPCs hit too high, too fast... Help? ALSO: My servers uptime is at 99%?

item.title: NPCs hit too high, too fast... Help? ALSO: My servers uptime is at 99%?
item.dc:creator: @PushedPrawn PushedPrawn
item.description:
@PushedPrawn wrote:

[quote=“Skillapwnz, post:2, topic:308007”]I know how to change the hit probably… lets use an example

npc = 84 Black_Demon 172 800 20

in your npc.cfg file which should be in config folder or something.

lets use black demon as example.

Npc = (npcid) (npcname) (npc cblvl) (npchealth) (spawnrate)

npc = 84 Black_Demon 172 800 20

so the 172 would be its combat level right? so if u want to make them hit lower u can just lower the combat and they hould hit lower, the 800 is the npc’s health if there is no number where the npc’s health is then u cant attack the npc, some npc’s are bugged, they have a attack button but u cant hit them so to fix that problem is by putting a health next to it, the 20 is the npc how much time it takes to spawn.

Im not sure about them hitting so fast though sorry.

hopefully this cleared a few things for you.[/quote]

Thank you, i’ll check that out… Thanks for helping with that question.

Read full topic
item.source: NPCs hit too high, too fast... Help? ALSO: My servers uptime is at 99%?

item.title: NPCs hit too high, too fast... Help? ALSO: My servers uptime is at 99%?
item.dc:creator: @Skillapwnz Skillapwnz
item.description:
@Skillapwnz wrote:

I know how to change the hit probably… lets use an example

npc = 84 Black_Demon 172 800 20

in your npc.cfg file which should be in config folder or something.

lets use black demon as example.

Npc = (npcid) (npcname) (npc cblvl) (npchealth) (spawnrate)

npc = 84 Black_Demon 172 800 20

so the 172 would be its combat level right? so if u want to make them hit lower u can just lower the combat and they hould hit lower, the 800 is the npc’s health if there is no number where the npc’s health is then u cant attack the npc, some npc’s are bugged, they have a attack button but u cant hit them so to fix that problem is by putting a health next to it, the 20 is the npc how much time it takes to spawn.

Im not sure about them hitting so fast though sorry.

hopefully this cleared a few things for you.

Read full topic
